# Transistor

A transistor is a semiconductor device used to amplify or switch electrical signals and power\.

# Bipolar Junction Transistor ( BJT)

![](l4.1-bipolar-junction-transistor-img/l41-bipolar-junction-transistor_4.png)

The  __BJT __ is constructed with three doped semiconductor regions separated by two  _pn_  _ _ junctions\, as shown in the epitaxial planar structure opposite\.

The three regions are called:

<span style="color:#0000cc"> __        \- __ </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc"> __ Emitter__ </span>

<span style="color:#0000cc"> __        \-  Base__ </span>

<span style="color:#0000cc"> __        \-  Collector__ </span>

![](l4.1-bipolar-junction-transistor-img/l41-bipolar-junction-transistor_5.png)

<span style="color:#c00000">substrate is a physical supporting material for the transistor</span>

For a BJT to operate properly as an amplifier\, the two  _pn_  _ _ junctions must be correctly biased with  <span style="color:#336600"> __external dc voltages\.__ </span>

<span style="color:#0000cc">In this course\, we </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc">will </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc">use the </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc"> _npn_ </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc"> _ _ </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc">transistor for illustration\. </span>

Operation of the  _pnp_  _ _ is the same as for the  _npn_  _ _ except that the roles of the electrons and holes\, the bias voltage polarities\, and the current directions are all reversed\.

<span style="color:#336600"> _Forward Biased _ </span>  <span style="color:#336600"> _npn_ </span>  <span style="color:#336600"> _ Transistor as Amplifier_ </span>

![](l4.1-bipolar-junction-transistor-img/l41-bipolar-junction-transistor_13.png)

<span style="color:#ff0000"> _Note: In Both cases\, BE is Forward biased and BC terminals is Reverse Biased_ </span>

<span style="color:#0000cc"> __DC Alpha \(__ </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc">α</span>  <span style="color:#0000cc"> __dc__ </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc"> __\) and AC Alpha \(__ </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc">α</span>  <span style="color:#0000cc"> __aa__ </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc"> __\)__ </span>

The ratio of the collector current \( _I_ C\) to the emitter current \( _I_ E\) is  __alpha__ \(α dc\) and  __alpha__ \(α ac\) \.

The alpha is a less\-used parameter than beta in transistor circuits\.

![](l4.1-bipolar-junction-transistor-img/l41-bipolar-junction-transistor_23.png)

Ideally::    α=1

In reality: α is between 0\.9 and 0\.998
